publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3695 Bill Butler: Christina Gorbachova, Drumchapel High School Pupil—That the Parliament welcomes the news that Christina Gorbachova, a pupil from Drumchapel High School, and her parents, Andre and Tanya, from Belarus have been released from Yarl’s Wood Detention Centre and allowed to return to Glasgow pending a review of their case by the Home Office; congratulates her fellow pupils and the wider Drumchapel community for their efforts on the family’s behalf; hopes that the review of their case by the Home Office results in the granting of leave to remain in Scotland; acknowledges the urgent need for an agreement to be reached with the Home Office which puts in place arrangements that protect the welfare of all children in asylum cases and takes into account the time spent in Scotland, and calls for negotiations taking place to arrive at such an agreement to be concluded as soon as possible. Supported by: Patrick Harvie*, Des McNulty*, John Home Robertson*, Rosie Kane*, Brian Adam*, Jackie Baillie*, Jim Mather*, Shiona Baird*, Robin Harper*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Chris Ballance*, Helen Eadie*, Mark Ballard*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Rob Gibson*, Stewart Stevenson*, Marlyn Glen*, Christine May*, Eleanor Scott*, Alex Neil*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Margo MacDonald*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3695 Christina Gorbachova, Drumchapel High School Pupil (lodged on 7 December 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Karen Whitefield*, Tommy Sheridan*, Fiona Hyslop*, Pauline McNeill*

S2M-3695 Bill Butler: Christina Gorbachova, Drumchapel High School Pupil—That the Parliament welcomes the news that Christina Gorbachova, a pupil from Drumchapel High School, and her parents, Andre and Tanya, from Belarus have been released from Yarl’s Wood Detention Centre and allowed to return to Glasgow pending a review of their case by the Home Office; congratulates her fellow pupils and the wider Drumchapel community for their efforts on the family’s behalf; hopes that the review of their case by the Home Office results in the granting of leave to remain in Scotland; acknowledges the urgent need for an agreement to be reached with the Home Office which puts in place arrangements that protect the welfare of all children in asylum cases and takes into account the time spent in Scotland, and calls for negotiations taking place to arrive at such an agreement to be concluded as soon as possible. Supported by: Patrick Harvie, Des McNulty, John Home Robertson, Rosie Kane, Brian Adam, Jackie Baillie, Jim Mather, Shiona Baird, Robin Harper, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Chris Ballance, Helen Eadie, Mark Ballard, Roseanna Cunningham, Rob Gibson, Stewart Stevenson, Marlyn Glen, Christine May, Eleanor Scott, Alex Neil, Dr Elaine Murray, Margo MacDonald, Donald Gorrie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Jamie Stone, Karen Whitefield, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona Hyslop, Pauline McNeill, Linda Fabiani*, Nora Radcliffe*, Murray Tosh*
S2M-3695 Christina Gorbachova, Drumchapel High School Pupil (lodged on 7 December 2005) Christine Grahame*
S2M-3695 Christina Gorbachova, Drumchapel High School Pupil (lodged on 7 December 2005) John Swinburne*
S2M-3695 Christina Gorbachova, Drumchapel High School Pupil (lodged on 7 December 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Trish Godman*
S2M-3695 Christina Gorbachova, Drumchapel High School Pupil (lodged on 7 December 2005) Elaine Smith*
